meanings.definition: A point in a narrative where tension or excitement builds towards a climax.
meanings.sent1: The subclimaxes in the story kept the readers engaged before the big finale.
meanings.sent2: The novel had several subclimaxes leading up to the main turning point.
meanings.sent3: The subclimaxes in the movie were like mini rollercoaster rides before the final drop.
meanings.sent4: Each subclimax in the plot was a stepping stone towards the ultimate peak of the story.
meanings.sent5: The subclimaxes were like puzzle pieces fitting together to create the full picture of the narrative.

meanings.definition: A lesser climax within a larger narrative structure.
meanings.sent1: The subclimaxes added depth to the story by providing smaller moments of resolution.
meanings.sent2: Each chapter had its own subclimax that contributed to the overall tension of the book.
meanings.sent3: The subclimaxes were like appetizers before the main course of the story's climax.
meanings.sent4: The subclimaxes were like stars in a constellation, each shining brightly in its own way.
meanings.sent5: The subclimaxes were like milestones along the journey towards the ultimate peak of the narrative.
